title: HTML td element with a row header (th[scope="row"])
description: This test verifies that the row header is announced for associated td elements when the scope="row" attribute is used.

chrome.output: "table with 2 columns and 2 rows"
"table end"
"name, greg, row 1"
"column 2, row 1, name, Greg"
(cell is announced as the header as you transition between rows)
(cell is announced as the header as you transition between rows)
(cell is announced as the header as you transition between rows)
(cell is announced as the header as you transition between rows)
(no header semantics surfaced, which implies that this is a cell)
(no header semantics surfaced, which implies that this is a cell)
(no header semantics surfaced, which implies that this is a cell)

history.message: Sample html was updated to better reflect a real word example, and data was updated as well.
Sample data has been added. This data has not been verified.
Update VO results and clean up data
Added Narrator results for NVDA and JAWS, updated NVDA+Chrome results.
